snippet: Volunteers in a study whose sleep patterns were shortened produced less insulin after eating, and higher glucose levels.
abstract: Orfeu M Buxton study in journal Science Translational Medicine finds further experimental evidence that inadequate sleep can increase the risk of obesity and diabetes.
